SEARCH
Package Branch

Class OrderList

java.lang.Object
Branch.OrderList
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class OrderList extends Object implements Serializable
Manages a collection of orders within a branch, providing functionality to add, remove, and retrieve orders using unique order IDs.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    OrderList()
    Constructs a new OrderList, initializing an empty collection of orders and setting the initial maximum order ID to a random number.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addOrder(Order order)
    Adds an order to the list.
    Order
    getOrder(int orderID)
    Retrieves an order by its order ID.
    ArrayList<Order>
    getOrderList()
    Gets a list of all orders currently managed by this OrderList.
    int
    nextOrderID()
    Generates and returns the next valid order ID, incrementing the internal counter to ensure uniqueness.
    void
    removeOrder(int orderID)
    Removes an order from the list based on the provided order ID.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderList

      public OrderList()
      Constructs a new OrderList, initializing an empty collection of orders and setting the initial maximum order ID to a random number.

  • Method Details

    • addOrder

      public void addOrder(Order order)
      Adds an order to the list. The order ID of the order is used as the key.
      Parameters:
      order - The order to be added to the list.

    • removeOrder

      public void removeOrder(int orderID)
      Removes an order from the list based on the provided order ID.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the order to be removed.

    • getOrder

      public Order getOrder(int orderID)
      Retrieves an order by its order ID.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the order to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The Order if it exists in the list; otherwise, returns null.

    • getOrderList

      public ArrayList<Order> getOrderList()
      Gets a list of all orders currently managed by this OrderList.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of all orders.

    • nextOrderID

      public int nextOrderID()
      Generates and returns the next valid order ID, incrementing the internal counter to ensure uniqueness.
      Returns:
      The next unique order ID.
